meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else for entertainment or fraud.
meanings.sent1: The personators at the party were dressed as famous celebrities.
meanings.sent2: The personators at the event were so convincing that many people thought they were the real stars.
meanings.sent3: The personators at the talent show had the audience laughing with their hilarious imitations.
meanings.sent4: The personators on stage transformed into different characters like chameleons.
meanings.sent5: The personators' performances were so entertaining that the audience couldn't stop applauding.

meanings.definition: The act of impersonating someone else.
meanings.sent1: Impersonating others is not allowed in the game, so the personators had to stop.
meanings.sent2: The personators' impersonation of the teacher was so accurate that even the principal was fooled.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the personators accidentally switched roles, causing confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The personators' mimicry was so spot-on that it felt like the real people were in the room.
meanings.sent5: The personators' talent for imitation was truly remarkable and left everyone amazed.
